title: Frank Gehry-MARTa Herford (Architecture Art Ebook).pdf
description:
Eng, Ger / 2005 / 112 Pages / ISBN 3764371625 / PDF / 8 MB

Frank O. Gehry's latest European museum building. Situated in Herford, a major centre of the German furniture industry, MARTa opened its doors to the public in December 2004. Conceived as a laboratory for redefining the relationship between art, design and industry, this fascinating complex houses art galleries, a competence centre (library and educational workshop facilities) and forum for conferences and cultural events. The gallery in the existent building has been kept a neutral White Cube. The dome, however, with its bulging curvatures that begin rising at 5 metres from a rectangular base, and the curved lines of the surrounding galleries bear Gehry's distinctive architectural signature. According to Artistic Director Jan Hoet, organiser of the 1992 Documenta and former Director of the SMAK Museum in Gent, the diverse character and atmosphere of the individual rooms provide a commensurate space for the dialogue between the traditionally discrete spheres of industry, design and art
